title: (x) Very cool script/handwriting "La Gafa" on Latin Lover T-shirt - LHF Goldsmith {Charles B}
author: peterjansma

comments.content:
identifont.com and whatthefont draw a blank unfortunately...

perhaps it is a custom made typeface?

Have you tried searching Part 7 of the Script Font ID Guide? It's possible it is custom, but if the a's all look identical it's a good bet that it's a font.

- Mike Yanega

Part 8 is also possible, because these letters do not connect very obviously. Tight tracking might make it look more connected than it is.

- Mike Yanega

Yeah, I went through it, but without result :-(  
From the fact that you fine lot don't recognise it, I deduct that it is indeed a custom production (and a mighty fine one).

So a logical question would be... could anyone suggest me a similar script font... equally brass and cheerful without too much curls?

Thank you all!
If anyone could be so kind to take a quick look see and in the Christmas spirit and all come with some awesome suggestions, it would be much appreciated :-)

The font is called LHF Goldsmith Script by John Studden  
 [http://www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/goldsmithscript.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202072649/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/goldsmithscript.shtml "http://www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/goldsmithscript.shtml")  
-Charles
